𒉀 NAGA niquer @ night ^^

𒉀 NAGA nagar naiger (swim) :

𒀀𒀀𒋗𒉀 waschen 𒀀𒅎 e4-tu15 to water : baden 𒉀=nagér (swim)

𒉀 ˢnaĝa ˢnang أُشْنَان ʔušnān "potash, soap" <> WaschLaugen 𒉀 ˢnama 𒈾𒈠 na-ma s'nama ሳሙና samuna shampoo صابون ṣabūn "soap" 𒉀𒋢𒌒 naĝa su-ub 𒉀 𒋳 naĝa sub₆ "rub with soap" complement

𒉀 Nager 𓇠𓇡𓂋 No'Ger 𓌾 Grain
Nor'Ger 𓎔𓌽 vs Sü'Ger 𓇔𓌽 𓇗𓌽sugar ⲱⲁⲭⲣⲓ vs Emmer 𓇣 𓏏 𓏮 𓌽

𒀀𒅎 ᵕa.tu15 •water "wash, bathe"
𒀀𒋗𒉀 ᵕa.tu5 •water "wash, bathe"
𒀀𒀀𒋗𒉀 ᵕa.tu17 •water "wash, bathe"

Ignore the common remaining Akkadian confusion:
NÍDABA, ŠE.NAGA=NIDABA "Nidaba" (cereal goddess)
AN.NAGA = NANIBGAL, AN.ŠE.NAGA = NÁNIBGAL "Nanibgal" (another name of the same goddess)
𒉃 NAGA-NAGA inversum = DALḪAMUN7; AN.NAGA-(AN.NAGA inversum) = DALḪAMUN5
AN.NAGA four times in cross shape = DALḪAMUN4: "whirlwind" ⋍ 𒀱

𒉀 NAGA nevegar νείφω śnieg "snow" : 𒊾 šeg₉ 𒀀𒋙𒉀 šeg₄ •šeˡg #šalgu salju •thelg < تلج talg תלגא "snow" @ Semitic
